current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
Authorizing expenditures by the Committee
		  on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry.

committee-name.#tail:
, reported the following original resolution; which
			 was referred to the
committee-name.#text:
Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and
			 Forestry

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is authorized from March 1, 2013, through
			 September 30, 2013, in its discretion (1) to make expenditures from the
			 contingent fund of the Senate, (2) to employ personnel, and (3) with the prior
			 consent of the Government department or agency concerned and the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Committee on
			 Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, to use on a reimbursable or non-reimbursable basis
			 the services of personnel of any such department or agency.

text.#text:
That, in carrying out its powers, duties,
			 and functions under the Standing Rules of the Senate, in accordance with its
			 jurisdiction under rule XXV of such rules, including holding hearings,
			 reporting such hearings, and making investigations as authorized by paragraphs
			 1 and 8 of rule XXVI of the Standing Rules of the Senate, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
for the
			 period March 1, 2013, through September 30, 2013, under this resolution shall
			 not exceed $2,464,069 of which amount (1) not to exceed $200,000 may be
			 expended for the procurement of the services of individual consultants, or
			 organizations thereof (as authorized by

, as amended), and (2) not to exceed $40,000 may be
			 expended for the training of the professional staff of such committee (under
			 procedures specified by
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 202(i) of the Legislative
			 Reorganization Act of 1946

section 202(j) of the Legislative Reorganization Act of
			 1946

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
under this
			 resolution shall be paid from the contingent fund of the Senate upon vouchers
			 approved by the

, except that vouchers shall not be
			 required (1) for the disbursement of salaries of employees paid at an annual
			 rate, or (2) for the payment of telecommunications provided by the

, or (3) for the
			 payment of stationery supplies purchased through the
